frameDefinitions: A Fugitive avoids recapture by or on the authority of Authorities in relation to a Crime which the Fugitive has committed or is suspected of having committed.
This frame contains words for individuals, i.e. humans, with respect to their Religion.
A Toxic_substance causes death or harm when introduced into or absorbed by a living organism, the Victim.
A Combatant is declared or loyal to a Side in a military Conflict.
A Speaker communicates about a Topic in such a way as to mislead an Addressee, either by telling outright lies or by presenting a message in a misleading form.
A Terrorist commits a violent or otherwise harmful Act upon a Victim in order to coerce or terrorize a government or populace.
frameExamples: He is in fact a <t>fugitive</t> of the law and you must inform the police if you see him.
The bells call the <t><fex name='Person'>faithful</fex></t> to evensong DNI
The  main product , sulphide , is <t>toxic</t> to cells
A 20-year=old Argentinian <t>guerilla</t> was firing at our squad.
I <t>lied</t> to you about your Christmas present.
Their <t>terrorism</t> against civilians will not be tolerated.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Fugitive</fen> has escaped and/or is evading capture by law enforcement <fen>Authorities</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is evading law enforcement.
This role identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is located.
The religious belief system that the <fen>Person</fen> follows.
The <fen>Victim</fen> is the being or entity that is capable of being harmed by the <fen>Toxic_substance</fen>.
This role marks expressions that indicate the substance which potentially causes harm to a <fen>Victim</fen>.
A living organism, object or process that produces a <fen>Toxic_substance</fen>.
The <fen>Combatant</fen> is the human being involved in combat.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a deceptive Message to the Addressee.
The person that receives a Message from the Speaker.
<fen>Topic</fen> is the entity to which the proposition or propositions  relate, that they are about.
The time at which the deception occurs.
The location at which the deception occurs.
The <fen>Terrorist</fen> commits the <fen>Act</fen> of terror for political or ideological gains.
The <fen>Act</fen> is the harmful action performed by the <fen>Terrorist</fen> or terrorist organization.
The <fen>Victim</fen> is most directly affected or harmed by the <fen>Act</fen> of terrorism.
The location in time when the <fen>Act</fen> takes place.
The location where the <fen>Act</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: Only two years earlier <fex>she</fex> had been on the lam from charges of embezzlement.
He was a fugitive <fex>in the early 1990s</fex>.
Sloan, on the lam <fex>in Michigan</fex> for the last five months, is due to appear in court this Monday.
Chocolate can be poisonous <fex>for some types of pets</fex>.
Highly toxic <fex>pollutants</fex> could be safely disposed of by burning them
A young man was bitten by a poisonous <fex>snake</fex> and lives to tell about it.
<fex>Politicians</fex> do nothing but tell lies about money.
You deceived me <fex>about the location of the diamonds</fex>.
Several domestic <fex>terrorists</fex> were operating from the site during the mid 1990s.
Many have suffered due to their acts of <fex><t>terrorism</t></fex>.
Cowardly acts of terrorism <fex>upon innocent men, women, and children</fex> is not a doorway to Heaven, but a gateway to Hell.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Death of a Dissident: The Poisoning of Alexander Litvinenko

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Blowing Up Russia: Terror From Within
Open Letter to the Commission for the Investigation of the Explosions of Apartment Houses in Moscow and Volgodonsk
the first half of the present decade
